stories.story: In ancient times, when Lord Lingaraj decided to make Bhubaneswar his abode, he appeared in the dreams of a devoted king. 'Build me a temple where the sun first touches the earth,' commanded the deity. The king searched far and wide until he found the perfect spot where the morning sun painted the landscape golden. Here, the magnificent Lingaraj Temple was born, becoming the soul of the Temple City. Even today, it's believed that the lord protects the city and its people, with each of the thousand temples telling a story of devotion and architectural marvel.

Legend says that Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II, while planning his dream capital, sought blessings from the wise sage who lived in the Aravalli hills. The sage advised him to build a city in hues of pink, the color of hospitality, to welcome all visitors with open arms. Thus, Jaipur became the Pink City, where every wall tells a story of royal grandeur and every street echoes with tales of valor and romance. The city's palaces and forts stand as timeless witnesses to the glory of Rajasthan's royal heritage.

Seven mystical islands once slept in the Arabian Sea, home to fisherfolk and the goddess Mumbadevi. When the British came seeking a port, they saw the islands' potential but didn't know the secret - the islands were protected by the goddess. It's said that Mumbai grew from a sleepy fishing village to a bustling metropolis because Mumbadevi blessed the land, bringing dreams from across India to find a home here. From the iconic Gateway of India to the buzzing film industry, every corner of Mumbai whispers tales of dreams, struggles, and triumphs.
